item.title: Benefits of a Gigabit Ethernet Network Connection
item.description:

It’s important to understand that those older telecom services you’ve been using are based on telephone technology. While they’re dependable, they weren’t designed for today’s network needs...

item.title: Dark Fiber for Bandwidth and Security
item.description:

One might wonder how lit fiber services could be insufficient, considering they offer speeds up to 10,000 Mbps (10 Gigabit SONET or Ethernet) and, in some cases, even up to 40 Gbps (OC-768)...

item.title: Video-Film Production Bandwidth
item.description:
The shift to digital video and film production has made it possible to work with collaborators across the globe. While physical delivery of tapes and disks is an option, tight production timelines often necessitate electronic file transfer. This, however, raises questions about how to carry out the process and the associated costs. Bandwidth is the defining feature of digital transfer services, representing the transmission speed in bits per second. It’s typically measured in Mbps or Gbps, and generally speaking, a higher bandwidth comes with a higher price tag...
